publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3933 Robert Brown: Current International Situation-That the Parliament recognises the strength of public opinion on the possibility of military action against Iraq; supports the United Nations' objective to rid Iraq of weapons of mass destruction; recognises that the United Nations weapons inspectors must be given time to complete their investigations in Iraq; believes that recourse to war should only be as a last resort after all political and diplomatic channels have been exhausted, and opposes any military action not sanctioned by a further resolution of the United Nations Security Council and a vote on a substantive motion in the House of Commons. Supported by: George Lyon*, Mrs Margaret Smith*, Iain Smith*, Ian Jenkins*, Nora Radcliffe*, Mr Keith Raffan*, Mr Mike Rumbles*, Tavish Scott*, Mr Jamie Stone*, John Farquhar Munro*, Donald Gorrie*
